page.title: 05 THE HOUGH
page.content: The Hough is a moraine or mound left behind from the Ice Age.Although we know how it was made there is a legend that two giants stood and threw mud at each other creating two piles,the Hough and the neighbouring Barff at Thorpe Willoughby.The Hambleton giant threw the most for the Barff is higher than the 40 metre high Hough. The Hough(Which is owned by Selby District Council)is mainly made up of pines,bordered by oaks and a few sycamores.If you are quiet and patient enough you may see some of the wildlife that inhabits it,such as wood pigeons(Of which there are quite a few)and grey squirrels as well as a few blackbirds even yellow hammers. Recently a'Trim Trail'has been built,it consists of several wooden obstacles used to help you keep fit.
